ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Accursed is man. How ungrateful is he!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Accursed be man! How stubbornly he denies the Truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: May (the disbelieving) human being be condemned! What makes him disbelieve?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: May man be slain – how ungrateful he is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Qutila mankind! How ungrateful he is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Cursed be man! how ungrateful is he!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Perish Man! How unthankful he is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Woe to man! How ungrateful he is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Perish man! how ungrateful he is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Perish man! How ungrateful is he!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Woe to man! What hath made him reject Allah;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Be cursed (the disbelieving) man! How ungrateful he is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Perish the human! How unthankful he is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Perish man! How thankless he is!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Cursed is man; how disbelieving is he.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [80:17] Perish man!, accursed be the disbeliever! What has made him ungrateful? (an interrogative statement meant as a rebuke) — what has driven him to disbelief?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Man is (self)-destroyed) the disbeliever, i.e. 'Utbah Ibn Abi Lahab, is cursed: (how ungrateful!) what has made him a disbelieve in Allah and in the stars of the Qur'an, i.e. in the star when it sets; it is also said that 731 this means: how extreme is his disbelief.
